question.body: We often take over-the-counter anti-inflammatory medicines to help us feel better when we are sick or injured. However, the inflammatory response is important after injury in our fight against infection and tissue repair and recovery. Which statement is NOT true concerning the inflammatory response?

multiple_choice.choice: Swelling and edema provide a more fluid environment, which allows white blood cells easier access to the site of infection of injury.
Increasing body temperature via fever makes it difficult for some organisms to grow.
Pain reminds us to get an injured or infected body part immobile so we donâ€™t spread the infection or exacerbate the injury.
Heat and redness indicate that your inflammatory response is out of whack and the tissue will not heal.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This statement is true. Swelling and edema are important for cell motility.
Incorrect. This statement is true. Many pathogens have a very limited temperature range where the can grow well. Fever's increasing the body temperature may impede pathogen growth.
Incorrect. This statement is true. Pain does help remind us to immobilize an area, so the body can use the most resources to fight infection and heal.
Correct. Heat and redness are part of the increase vasodilation in the affected area. It means the inflammatory response is working.
